snippet: A drug dealer who helped beat a woman and two men with a bat is the first federal defendant in the state to receive the penalty since federal capital punishment was reinstated in 1988.
abstract: Federal Judge Janet Bond Arterton sentences Connecticut drug dealer Azibo Aquart to death for 2005 killings of three people in Bridgeport during turf dispute over crack cocaine sales; Aquart is first federal court defendant in Connecticut to receive death penalty since federal capital punishment was reinstated there in 1988.
lead_paragraph: A drug dealer who helped beat a woman and two men with a bat is the first federal defendant in the state to receive the penalty since federal capital punishment was reinstated in 1988.

headline.seo: Connecticut Man Sentenced to Death in 3 Killings
headline.main: Connecticut Man Sentenced to Death in Three Killings
headline.print_headline: Connecticut Man Sentenced To Death in Three Killings
